basics.description: **Note:** _There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing._ SAP is synonymous with enterprise business. It drives multiple business applications and is the custodian for massive amounts of critical, sensitive data. SAP systems are growing in complexity as organizations expand beyond the base capabilities. This growth causes security risk to rise and allows threats to emerge across modules, so threat correlation is an important part of ensuring SAP security. The Microsoft Sentinel Continuous Threat Monitoring for SAP provides comprehensive and continuous threat detection and analytics, effectively identifying real threats and malicious behaviours. Microsoft Sentinel has built-in API connectors to natively collect transaction logs necessary for monitoring SAP and includes out of the box security content (detections, dashboard) for securing SAP NetWeaver system in Azure and outside of Azure as well. **Data Connectors:** 1, **Workbooks:** 1, **Analytic Rules:** 61, **Workspace functions:** 51, **Watchlists:** 18 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

metadata.hidden: Hiding location, we get it from the log analytics workspace

options.text: This Sentinel solution supports an architecture where SOC data, SAP data can reside in different workspace (PREVIEW). If this is the case for your deployment, enter the details of the deployment target workspace and then check the "Some of the data is on a different workspace" box below.

basics.name: getLAWorkspace
basics.toolTip: This filters by workspaces that exist in the Resource Group selected

basics.name: MyDataIsElsewhere
basics.label: Some of the data is on a different workspace
basics.toolTip: Check this to have this solution read data from another workspace

basics.name: workspace
basics.label: Deployment target workspace
basics.toolTip: This dropdown will list only workspace that exists in the Resource Group selected

options.text: The deployement target workspace ID is:
[concat(coalesce(subscription().id,''), '/resourceGroups/', toLower(resourceGroup().name), '/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/',basics('workspace'))]

options.text: This Solution installs the data connector for SAP. You can get SAP custom log data in your Microsoft Sentinel workspace. After installing the solution, configure and enable this data connector by following guidance in Manage solution view.

link.label: Learn more about connecting data sources

options.text: This Microsoft Sentinel Solution installs workbooks. Workbooks provide a flexible canvas for data monitoring, analysis, and the creation of rich visual reports within the Azure portal. They allow you to tap into one or many data sources from Microsoft Sentinel and combine them into unified interactive experiences.
This solution installs the following analytic rule templates. After installing the solution, create and enable analytic rules in Manage solution view.

elements.name: analytic1
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) Capture-replay vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver [CVE-2023-0014]

options.text:
SAP NetWeaver ABAP Server and ABAP Platform creates information about system identity in an ambiguous format.
This may be exploited by malicious users to obtain illegitimate access to the system.
Read SAP note 3281854 - FAQ for Security Note 3089413 for more details. This alert rule helps to identify current risks for systems in the landscape.

elements.name: analytic2
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) Critical authorizations assignment - New Authorization Value

options.text:
Identifies assignment of a critical authorization object value to a new user.
Source Action: Assign a new authorization object / update existing one in a role using PFCG.

Critical authorization objects should be maintained in watchlist ""SAP - Critical Authorization Objects""

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Change Documents Log*
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  User MD*

elements.name: analytic3
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) Data collection health check

options.text: Produces insights on potential SAP agent connectivity issues.

elements.name: analytic4
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) Data exported from a production system using a transport

options.text: Transports are like pull requests and are normally created in a developement system. This alert rule is triggered when a transport is released from a production system, with data coming from a sensitive table.

elements.name: analytic5
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) Dynamic Anomaly based Audit Log Monitor Alerts

options.text:
SAP Audit log events with message IDs preconfigured in Watchlist SAP_Dynamic_Audit_Log_Monitor_Configuration and with RuleType = "AnomaliesOnly" will be shown here.
See [Sentinel4SAP Dcoumentation](https://aka.ms/sapsecdocs) for further information

elements.name: analytic6
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) File Downloaded From a Malicious IP Address

options.text:
User has downloaded a file from an SAP system using an IP address known to be malicious.
Malicious IP addresses are obtained from threat intelligence services. For additional information visit the [Connect your threat intelligence platform to Microsoft Sentinel]( https://learn.microsoft.com/Azure/sentinel/connect-threat-intelligence-tip) how-to page.
This Alert rule allows for a cross-workspace query to accommodate an architecture where the threat intelligence data resides in a different workspace than the one which holds the SAP data.

elements.name: analytic7
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) HANA DB - Assign Admin Authorizations

options.text:
Identifies admin privileges/roles assignment.

Source Action: Assign a user with any Admin role / privileges.

*Data Sources: Linux Agent - Syslog*

elements.name: analytic8
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) HANA DB - Audit Trail Policy Changes

options.text:
Identifies changes for HANA DB audit trail policies.

Source Action: Create / update existing audit policy in security definitions.

*Data Sources: Linux Agent - Syslog*

elements.name: analytic9
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) HANA DB - Deactivation of Audit Trail

options.text:
Identifies deactivation of HANA DB audit log.

Source Action: Deactivate Audit Log in HANA DB security defnitions.

*Data Sources: Linux Agent - Syslog*

elements.name: analytic10
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) HANA DB - User Admin actions

options.text:
Identifies user administration actions.

Souirce Action: Create/Update/Delete a DB User.

*Data Sources: Linux Agent - Syslog*

elements.name: analytic11
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) High volume of potentially sensitive data exported

options.text: High volume of data exported via files in proximity to an execution of a sensitive transaction, a sensitive program or direct access to sensitive table.

elements.name: analytic12
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) New trusted RFC connection capture-replay vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver [CVE-2023-0014]

options.text:
SAP NetWeaver ABAP Server and ABAP Platform creates information about system identity in an ambiguous format.
This may be exploited by malicious users to obtain illegitimate access to the system.
Read SAP note 3281854 - FAQ for Security Note 3089413 for more details. This alert rule helps to identify newly added trusted RFC relationships.

elements.name: analytic13
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) Printing of potentially sensitive data

options.text:
The alert rule was disabled due to too many consecutive failures. Reason: Server is failing to execute the query of this rule, please verify the query. User has requested printing or has printed data which is potentially sensitive.
Data is considered sensitive if it is obtained by using a sensitive transaction, by executing a sensitive program or by directly accessing a sensitive table.

elements.name: analytic14
elements.label: SAP - (Preview) Sensitive data saved into a USB drive

options.text: SAP data exported via files and saved into a recently mounted USB drive in proximity to an execution of a sensitive transaction, a sensitive program or direct access to a sensitive table.

elements.name: analytic15
elements.label: SAP - Activation or Deactivation of ICF Service

options.text:
Identifies activation or deactivation of ICF Services.
Source Action: Activate or deactivate a service using SICF.
*Data Sources: SAPcon - Table Data Log*

elements.name: analytic16
elements.label: SAP - Assignment of a sensitive profile

options.text:
Identifies new assignments of a sensitive profile to a user.

Source Action: Assign a profile to a User using SU01.

Sensitive profiles can be maintained using the "SAP - Sensitive Profiles" watchlist

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Change Documents Log*

elements.name: analytic17
elements.label: SAP - Assignment of a sensitive role

options.text:
Identifies new assignments for a sensitive role to a user.

Source Action: Assign a role to a User using SU01 / PFCG.

Sensitive roles should be maintained in watchlist "SAP -  Sensitive Roles"

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Change Documents Log, Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic18
elements.label: SAP - Brute Force (RFC)

options.text:
Identifies brute force attacks on the SAP system using RFC logons

Source Action: Attempt to login from the same IP to several systems/clients within the scheduled time interval using RFC

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic19
elements.label: SAP - Change in a Sensitive Privileged User

options.text:
Identifies changes of sensitive privileged users. Source Action: Change user details / authorizations using SU01.

Users are considered as Privileged when one of these conditions apply:

  • If they are named in the SAP - Privileged Users Watchlist
  • If they have a profile which is included in the SAP - Sensitive Profiles watchlist
  • If they have a role which is included in the SAP - Sensitive Roles watchlist This Rule requires a fresh full reload of SAP user master data to be performed daily. *Data Sources: SAPcon - Audit Log* *Data Sources: SAPcon - User MD*

elements.name: analytic20
elements.label: SAP - Client Configuration Change

options.text:
Identifies changes for client configuration such as: Client role, Changes recording mode.

Source Action:  Perofrm client configurations changes using SCC4 transaction code.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic21
elements.label: SAP - Critical authorizations assignment - New User Assignment

options.text:
Identifies assignment of a critical authorization object value to a new user.

Source Action: Assign a new user to a role which holds critical authorization values using SU01/PFCG.

Critical authorization objects should be maintained in watchlist ""SAP - Critical Authorization Objects""

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Change Documents Log*

elements.name: analytic22
elements.label: SAP - Data has Changed during Debugging Activity

options.text:
Identifies changes for runtime data during a debugging activity.
Source Action: Activate Debug ("/h"), Select a field for change and update it's value.

**Recommended for Production only**

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic23
elements.label: SAP - Deactivation of Security Audit Log

options.text:
Identifies deactivation of Security Audit Log

Source Action: Disable secruity Audit Log using SM19/RSAU_CONFIG.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic24
elements.label: SAP - Debugging Activities

options.text:
Identifies all debugging related activities.

Source Action: Activate Debug ("/h") in system, debug an active process, add breakpoint to source code etc.

**Recommended for Production only**

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic25
elements.label: SAP - Dialog logon attempt from a privileged user

options.text:
Identifies dialog logon (Type AUM) attempts by priviledged users (See Function SAPUsersGetPrivileged) on SAP system .
Source Action: Attempt to login from the same IP to several systems/clients within the scheduled time interval.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic26
elements.label: SAP - Dynamic ABAP Program

options.text: Identifies execution of dynamic ABAP programming. For example, ABAP code was dynamically created/changed/deleted. Source Action: Create an ABAP Report which uses ABAP program generation commands such as "INSERT REPORT" and execute it. Excluded Transaction Codes can be maintained in "SAP - Transactions for ABAP Generations" watchlist. *Data Sources: SAPcon - Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic27
elements.label: SAP - Dynamic Deterministic Audit Log Monitor

options.text:
SAP Audit log events with message IDs preconfigured in Watchlist SAP_Dynamic_Audit_Log_Monitor_Configuration will be shown here.
See [Sentinel4SAP Dcoumentation](https://aka.ms/sapsecdocs) for further information

elements.name: analytic28
elements.label: SAP - Dynamic RFC Destination

options.text: Identifies execution of RFC using dynamic destinations. Source Action: Execute an ABAP report which is using dynamic destinations (cl_dynamic_destination). Sample report: DEMO_RFC_DYNAMIC_DEST. *Data Sources: SAPcon - Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic29
elements.label: SAP - Execution of a Sensitive ABAP Program

options.text:
Identifies direct execution of a sensitive ABAP program.

Source Action: Execute a program directly using SE38/SA38/SE80.

**Recommended for Production only**

ABAP Programs should be maintained in watchlist "SAP - Sensitive ABAP Programs"

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic30
elements.label: SAP - Execution of a Sensitive Transaction Code

options.text:
Identifies execution of a sensitive Transaction Code.

Source Action: Execute a sensitive Transaction Code.

**Recommended for Production only**

Transaction Codes should be maintained in watchlist ""SAP - Sensitive Transaction Codes""

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic31
elements.label: SAP - Execution of an Obsolete or an Insecure Function Module

options.text:
Identifies execution of an obsolete/insecure ABAP Function Module.

Source Action: Execute an obsolete/insecure function module directly using SE37.

**Recommended for Production only**

Obsolete functions should be maintained in "SAP - Obsolete Function Modules" Watchlist.

elements.name: analytic32
elements.label: SAP - Execution of an Obsolete or an Insecure Program

options.text:
Identifies execution of an obsolete insecure ABAP program.
Source Action: Execute a program directly using SE38/SA38/SE80 or by using a background job.
**Recommended for Production only**
Obsolete programs should be maintained in "SAP - Obsolete Programs" Watchlist
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic33
elements.label: SAP - Execution of Sensitive Function Module

options.text:
Identifies execution of a sensitive ABAP Function Module.

Source Action: Execute a sensitive function module directly using SE37.

**Recommended for Production only**

Sensitive functions should be maintained in "SAP - Sensitive Function Modules" Watchlist.
Table logging changes should be activated for table "EUFUNC" in backend. (SE13)

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Table Data Log*

elements.name: analytic34
elements.label: SAP - FTP for non authorized servers

options.text:
Identifies FTP connection for non authorized server.
Maintain new Watchlist, similar to SAPFTP_SERVERS
Source Action: Create a new FTP connection e.g. by using Function Module FTP_CONNECT.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic35
elements.label: SAP - Function Module tested

options.text:
Identifies testing of a function module.

Source Action: Test a function module using  SE37 / SE80.

**Recommended for Production only**

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic36
elements.label: SAP - Insecure FTP servers configuration

options.text:
Identifies Insecure FTP servers configuration - FTP Whitelist is empty / Contains Placeholders.

Source Action: Do not maintain / maintain values which contains placeholders in table SAPFTP_SERVERS using maintenance view SAPFTP_SERVERS_V. (SM30)

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic37
elements.label: SAP - Lifecycle - SAP Notes were implemented in system

options.text:
Identifies SAP Notes implementation in the system.

Source Action: Implement SAP Note using SNOTE/TCI.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Change Requests*

elements.name: analytic38
elements.label: SAP - Login from unexpected network

options.text:
Identifies logons from an unexpected network.

Source Action: Logon to the backend system from an IP address which is not assigned to one of the netwroks.

Networks should be maintained in watchlist "SAP - Networks"

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic39
elements.label: SAP - Missing configuration in the Dynamic Security Audit Log Monitor

options.text:
An SAP audit log event has occurred bearing a message ID which was not maintained in the SAP_Dynamic_Audit_Log_Monitor_Configuration watchlist.
The SAP_Dynamic_Audit_Log_Monitor_Configuration watchlist allows for dynamically alerting on SAP audit log events.
Recommended solution - go to the SAP_Dynamic_Audit_Log_Monitor_Configuration and add the missing SAP audit log message ID.  Specify a severity level of medium or high to have this message ID covered by the alerts based on rule "Dynamic Security Audit Log Monitor".

elements.name: analytic40
elements.label: SAP - Multiple Files Download

options.text:
Identifies multiple files downloads for a user within a specific timerange.

Source Action: Download multiple files while using SAPGui to Excel/Lists etc.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic41
elements.label: SAP - Multiple Logons by IP

options.text:
Identifies logon of several users from same IP within scheduled time interval.

Source Action: Logon using several users thorugh the same IP.
Networks can be excluded from this alert by specifying ranges in the 'SAP - Excluded Networks' watchlist.
This rule alerts on "empty" IP addresses as well- Add an entry with serachkey= 000.00.000.0 and Description= EmptyIPAddressesShouldBeExcluded in the 'SAP - Excluded Networks' watchlist to avoid alerting on empty IP addresses
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic42
elements.label: SAP - Multiple Password Changes

options.text:
Identifies multiple password changes at different levels:
1. Users across systems
2. Per user performing the password change
3. Per user who's password is being changed

Source Action: Change user password

elements.name: analytic43
elements.label: SAP - Multiple Spool Executions

options.text:
Identifies multiple spools for a user within a specific timerange.

Source Action: Create and execute multiple Spool Jobs from any type by a user. (SP01)

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Spool Log*

elements.name: analytic44
elements.label: SAP - Multiple Spool Output Executions

options.text:
Identifies multiple spools for a user within a specific timerange.

Source Action: Create and execute multiple Spool Jobs from any type by a user. (SP01)

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Spool Log*

elements.name: analytic45
elements.label: SAP - Multiple Subnets by User

options.text:
Identifies logon of the same user from several subnets within scheduled time interval.
Multiple configuration options available within the query.

Source Action: Logon using the same user thorugh different IP's.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic46
elements.label: SAP - New ICF Service Handlers

options.text:
Identifies creation of ICF Handlers.
Source Action: Assign a new handler to a service using SICF.
*Data Sources: SAPcon - Table Data Log*

elements.name: analytic47
elements.label: SAP - New ICF Services

options.text:
Identifies creation of ICF Services.
Source Action: Create a service using SICF.
*Data Sources: SAPcon - Table Data Log*

elements.name: analytic48
elements.label: SAP - RFC Execution of a Sensitive Function Module

options.text:
Identifies execution of a sensitive function module using RFC.

Source Action: Execute a function module using RFC.

**Recommended for Production only**

Function Modules should be maintained in watchlist "SAP - Sensitive Function Modules"

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic49
elements.label: SAP - Security Audit Log Configuration Change

options.text:
Idenitifes changes for configuration in Securiy Audit Log

Source Action: change any  Security Audit Log Configuration using SM19/RSAU_CONFIG. (Filters/Status/Recording mode etc..)

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic50
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive Privileged User Logged in

options.text:
Identifies Dialog logon of a sensitive privileged user.
Source Action: Logon to the backend system using SAP* or anoter privileged user.

Priveleged users should be maintained in "SAP - Privileged Users" Watchlist

This rule requires a fresh full reload of the SAP user master data to be performed daily.
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  User MD*

elements.name: analytic51
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive privileged user makes a change in another user

options.text:
Identifies changes  of sensitive privileged users in other users.

Source Action: Change user details / authorizations using SU01.

Priveleged users should be maintained in "SAP - Privileged Users" Watchlist

This rule requires a fresh full reload of SAP user master data to be performed daily.
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  User MD*

elements.name: analytic52
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive Role Changes

options.text:
Identifies changes in sensitive roles.
Source Action: Change a role using PFCG.
Sensitive roles should be maintained in "SAP - Sensitive Roles" Watchlist

*Data Sources: SAPcon - Change Documents Log*

elements.name: analytic53
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive Tables Direct Access By Dialog Logon

options.text:
Identifies generic table access by dialog logon

Source Action: Open table contents using SE11/SE16/SE16N.

**Recommended for Production only**

Tables should be maintained in ""SAP - Sensitive Tables"" Watchlist.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic54
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive Tables Direct Access By RFC Logon

options.text:
Identifies generic table access by RFC logon

Source Action: Open table contents using SE11/SE16/SE16N.

**Recommended for Production only**

Tables should be maintained in "SAP - Sensitive Tables" Watchlist.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic55
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive User's Password Change and Log in

options.text:
Identifies password changes for privileged users.

Source Action: Change Password for a user and login to the system.

Priveleged users should be maintained in "SAP - Privileged Users" Watchlist

This rule requires a fresh full reload of SAP user master data to be performed daily.
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  User MD*

elements.name: analytic56
elements.label: SAP - SPNego Attack

options.text:
Identifies SPNego Replay Attack.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic57
elements.label: SAP - Spool Takeover

options.text:
Identifies a user printing a spool request which was created by someone else.

Source Action: Create a Spool Request using one user, Output it in using another user.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Spool Log*
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Spool Output Log*

elements.name: analytic58
elements.label: SAP - System Configuration Change

options.text:
Identifies changes for system configuration.

Source Action:  Adapt system change options or software components modifcation using SE06 transaction code.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic59
elements.label: SAP - Transaction is unlocked

options.text:
Identifies unlocking of a transaction.

Source Action: Unlock a transaction code using SM01/SM01_DEV/SM01_CUS.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic60
elements.label: SAP - User Creates and uses new user

options.text:
Identifies a user creating and using other users.

Source Action: Create a user using SU01. Login using the newly created user from the same IP.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*

elements.name: analytic61
elements.label: SAP - User Unlocks and uses other users

options.text:
A user unlocked another, and then used the other's user credentials.

Source Action: Unlock a user using SU01. Login using the unlocked user from the same IP.

*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Audit Log*
*Data Sources: SAPcon -  Change Documents Log*

Microsoft Sentinel watchlists enable the collection of data from external data sources for correlation with the events in your Microsoft Sentinel environment. Once created, you can use watchlists in your search, detection rules, threat hunting, and response playbooks. Watchlists are stored in your Microsoft Sentinel workspace as name-value pairs and are cached for optimal query performance and low latency. Once deployment is successful, the installed watchlists will be available in the Watchlists blade under 'My Watchlists'.
This Sentinel solution contains prefilled watchlists with best-practice data. The import of these watchlists is recommended for a cold-starting workspace.

[concat(if(contains(string(basics('getSolutionMetadataApi').properties.dependencies.criteria), '"kind":"Watchlist"'), 'It appears that the target workspace already contains watchlists originating from this solution. 
Please indicate which of the below watchlists content you would like to refresh. Watchlists that are included with this solution but were not found on your workspace will be added with their items by default.','The watchlists below will be added to your workspcae with their content.'), ' Learn More.')]

elements.name: watchlist1
elements.label: SAP - Critical Authorizations

options.text: Critical Authorizations object which their assignment should be governed.

elements.name: watchlist1CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist2
elements.label: SAP - Excluded Networks

options.text: Internal and maintenance of excluded networks for ignoring web dispatchers, terminal servers etc.

elements.name: watchlist2CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist3
elements.label: SAP - Excluded Users

options.text: System users which are logged in the systems need to be ignored. (for example Multiple logons by user alert)

elements.name: watchlist3CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

options.text: FTP Servers for identification of unauthorized connections.

elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist5

options.text: Internal and maintenance networks for identification of unauthorized logins.

elements.name: watchlist5CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist6
elements.label: SAP - Obsolete Function Modules

options.text: Obsolete Function Modules which their execution should be governed.

elements.name: watchlist6CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist7
elements.label: SAP - Obsolete Programs

options.text: Obsolete ABAP programs (reports) which their execution should be governed.

elements.name: watchlist7CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist8
elements.label: SAP - Privileged Users

options.text: Privileged users which are under extra restrictions.

elements.name: watchlist8CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist9
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive ABAP Programs

options.text: Sensitive ABAP programs (reports) which their execution should be governed.

elements.name: watchlist9CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist10
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive Function Modules

options.text: Sensitive Function Modules which their execution should be governed.

elements.name: watchlist10CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist11
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive Profiles

options.text: Sensitive profiles which their assignment should be governed.

elements.name: watchlist11CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
elements.label: Refresh this wathclist with prebuilt content

elements.name: watchlist12
elements.label: SAP - Sensitive Roles

options.text: Sensitive roles which their assignment should be governed.

elements.name: watchlist12CB
elements.toolTip: You already have this watchlist. Check this box to force the watchlist update. All of your original items will be kept.
